New Records: Shakib Al Hasan was not impressed with the lbw decision against him and had to be forced off
Key Match Events: Pakistan won by 5 wickets (with 11 balls remaining)
Pakistan cranked up the deja vu in Adelaide on Sunday as they sailed into the T20 World Cup semi-finals
Shakib Al Hasan was adjudged lbw on field, and upheld on DRS even though he was absolutely certain he'd nicked the ball
Bangladesh were 71 for 1 at one stage. Then they lost their captain and could manage only 127
Shaheen Afridi reverse swung his way past a right-hander, just like Wasim Akram did all those years ago, picking up 4 for 22
Litton Das whacked Shaheen for six over square leg
Pakistan's ace legspinner, Shadab Khan, goes at 19 against left-handers (Econ 7.8)
Pakistan's first fifty partnership for the first wicket at this T20 World Cup
Babar Azam stepped up and rallied his troops and now here they are. With two wickets in two balls. Soumya Sarkar and Shakib Al Hasan are both gone!
Pre-Game Insights: Bangladesh are still in it too! This has turned into a straight out knockout game. Winner takes all!
Pakistan AND Bangladesh will feel perfectly at home in Sydney, which has been doing its best impression of the subcontinent
This Pakistan team is quality. It has too much to have ever had any business looking like they were out of the tournament
Pakistan's main man, their left-arm hero, Shaheen Afridi, gets it to go the other way and the batter was little more than a cardboard cutout
The Cornered Tigers TM of 1992 have a golden chance to make the semi-finals in 2022 as well now that South Africa have chok-- you know the word...
Post-Match Reflections: Pakistan cranked up the deja vu in Adelaide on Sunday as they sailed into the T20 World Cup semi-finals
Pakistan's ace legspinner, Shadab Khan, goes at 19 against left-handers (Econ 7.8)

Miscellaneous Highlights: The pitch that was used in the SA vs Netherlands game is already had 40 overs on it - during which time we realised that shot-making gets tougher as the match wears on
The fans know what's at stake. There's just that little bit extra in their flag waving
The players are belting it out. The people in the crowd have their hands over their hearts
This Bangladesh team has already gone where no Bangladesh team has gone before in a T20 World Cup
Shakib Al Hasan they already have one of the games greatest allrounders in history
Others: Bangladesh are making the right moves
Pakistan's top order has been a concern all tournament
